00013 function XMLDoc(source, errFn) {
00014     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00015     function:       XMLDoc
00016 
00017     Author: mike@idle.org
00018 
00019     Description:
00020         a constructor for an XML document
00021         source: the string containing the document
00022         errFn: the (optional) function used to log errors
00023     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00024     // stack for document construction
00025     this.topNode=null;
00026 
00027     // set up the properties and methods for this object
00028     this.errFn = errFn;          // user defined error functions
00029 
00030     this.createXMLNode = _XMLDoc_createXMLNode;
00031     this.error = _XMLDoc_error;
00032     this.getUnderlyingXMLText = _XMLDoc_getUnderlyingXMLText;
00033     this.handleNode = _XMLDoc_handleNode;
00034     this.hasErrors = false;      // were errors found during the parse?
00035     this.insertNodeAfter =  _XMLDoc_insertNodeAfter;
00036     this.insertNodeInto = _XMLDoc_insertNodeInto;
00037     this.loadXML = _XMLDoc_loadXML;
00038       this.parse = _XMLDoc_parse;
00039     this.parseAttribute = _XMLDoc_parseAttribute;
00040     this.parseDTD = _XMLDoc_parseDTD;
00041     this.parsePI = _XMLDoc_parsePI;
00042     this.parseTag = _XMLDoc_parseTag;
00043     this.removeNodeFromTree = _XMLDoc_removeNodeFromTree;
00044     this.replaceNodeContents = _XMLDoc_replaceNodeContents;
00045     this.selectNode = _XMLDoc_selectNode;
00046       this.selectNodeText = _XMLDoc_selectNodeText;
00047 
00048       this.source = source;        // the string source of the document
00049 
00050     // parse the document
00051 
00052     if (this.parse()) {
00053         // we've run out of markup - check the stack is now empty
00054         if (this.topNode!=null) {
00055             return this.error("expected close " + this.topNode.tagName);
00056         }
00057         else {
00058             return true;
00059         }
00060     }
00061 }; // end function XMLDoc

00078 function _XMLDoc_error(str) {
00079     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00080     function:       _XMLDoc_error
00081 
00082     Author: mike@idle.org
00083 
00084     Description:
00085         used to log an error in parsing or validating
00086     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00087 
00088     this.hasErrors=true;
00089     if(this.errFn){
00090         this.errFn("ERROR: " + str);
00091     }else if(this.onerror){
00092         this.onerror("ERROR: " + str);
00093     }
00094     return 0;
00095 
00096 } // end function _XMLDoc_error

00099 function _XMLDoc_getTagNameParams(tag,obj){
00100     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00101     function:       _XMLDoc_getTagNameParams
00102 
00103     Author: xwisdom@yahoo.com
00104 
00105     Description:
00106         convienience function for the nodeSearch routines
00107     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00108     var elm=-1,e,s=tag.indexOf('[');
00109     var attr=[];
00110     if(s>=0){
00111         e=tag.indexOf(']');
00112         if(e>=0)elm=tag.substr(s+1,(e-s)-1);
00113         else obj.error('expected ] near '+tag);
00114         tag=tag.substr(0,s);
00115         if(isNaN(elm) && elm!='*'){
00116             attr=elm.substr(1,elm.length-1); // remove @
00117             attr=attr.split('=');
00118             if(attr[1]) { //remove "
00119                 s=attr[1].indexOf('"');
00120                 attr[1]=attr[1].substr(s+1,attr[1].length-1);
00121                 e=attr[1].indexOf('"');
00122                 if(e>=0) attr[1]=attr[1].substr(0,e);
00123                 else obj.error('expected " near '+tag)
00124             };elm=-1;
00125         }else if(elm=='*') elm=-1;
00126     }
00127     return [tag,elm,attr[0],attr[1]]
00128 } // end function _XMLDoc_getTagNameParams

00131 function _XMLDoc_getUnderlyingXMLText() {
00132     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00133     function:       _XMLDoc_getUnderlyingXMLText
00134 
00135     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
00136 
00137     Description:
00138         kicks off the process that returns the XML text representation of the XML
00139         document inclusive of any changes made by the manipulation of the DOM
00140     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00141     var strRet = "";
00142     //for now, hardcode the xml version 1 information. When we handle Processing Instructions later, this
00143     //should be looked at again
00144     strRet = strRet + "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>";
00145     if (this.docNode==null) {
00146         return;
00147     }
00148 
00149     strRet = _displayElement(this.docNode, strRet);
00150     return strRet;
00151 
00152 } // end function _XMLDoc_getCurrentXMLText

00156 function _XMLDoc_handleNode(current) {
00157     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00158     function:   _XMLDoc_handleNode
00159 
00160     Author: mike@idle.org
00161 
00162     Description:
00163         adds a markup element to the document
00164     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00165 
00166     if ((current.nodeType=='COMMENT') && (this.topNode!=null)) {
00167         return this.topNode.addElement(current);
00168     }
00169     else if ((current.nodeType=='TEXT') ||  (current.nodeType=='CDATA')) {
00170 
00171         // if the current node is a text node:
00172 
00173 
00174         // if the stack is empty, and this text node isn't just whitespace, we have
00175         // a problem (we're not in a document element)
00176 
00177         if(this.topNode==null) {
00178             if (trim(current.content,true,false)=="") {
00179                 return true;
00180             }
00181             else {
00182                 return this.error("expected document node, found: " + current);
00183             }
00184         }
00185         else {
00186             // otherwise, append this as child to the element at the top of the stack
00187             return this.topNode.addElement(current);
00188         }
00189 
00190 
00191     }
00192     else if ((current.nodeType=='OPEN') || (current.nodeType=='SINGLE')) {
00193         // if we find an element tag (open or empty)
00194         var success = false;
00195 
00196         // if the stack is empty, this node becomes the document node
00197 
00198         if(this.topNode==null) {
00199             this.docNode = current;
00200             current.parent = null;
00201             success = true;
00202         }
00203         else {
00204             // otherwise, append this as child to the element at the top of the stack
00205             success = this.topNode.addElement(current);
00206         }
00207 
00208 
00209         if (success && (current.nodeType!='SINGLE')) {
00210             this.topNode = current;
00211         }
00212 
00213         // rename it as an element node
00214 
00215         current.nodeType = "ELEMENT";
00216 
00217         return success;
00218     }
00219 
00220     // if it's a close tag, check the nesting
00221 
00222     else if (current.nodeType=='CLOSE') {
00223 
00224         // if the stack is empty, it's certainly an error
00225 
00226         if (this.topNode==null) {
00227             return this.error("close tag without open: " +  current.toString());
00228         }
00229         else {
00230 
00231             // otherwise, check that this node matches the one on the top of the stack
00232 
00233             if (current.tagName!=this.topNode.tagName) {
00234                 return this.error("expected closing " + this.topNode.tagName + ", found closing " + current.tagName);
00235             }
00236             else {
00237                 // if it does, pop the element off the top of the stack
00238                 this.topNode = this.topNode.getParent();
00239             }
00240         }
00241     }
00242     return true;
00243 } // end function _XMLDoc_handleNode

00247 function _XMLDoc_insertNodeAfter (referenceNode, newNode) {
00248     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00249     function:   _XMLDoc_insertNodeAfter
00250 
00251     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
00252 
00253     Description:
00254         inserts a new XML node after the reference node;
00255 
00256         for example, if we insert the node <tag2>hello</tag2>
00257         after tag1 in the xml <rootnode><tag1></tag1></rootnode>
00258         we will end up with <rootnode><tag1></tag1><tag2>hello</tag2></rootnode>
00259 
00260         NOTE: the return value of this function is a new XMLDoc object!!!!
00261 
00262     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00263 
00264     var parentXMLText = this.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00265     var selectedNodeXMLText = referenceNode.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00266     var originalNodePos = parentXMLText.indexOf(selectedNodeXMLText) + selectedNodeXMLText.length;
00267     var newXML = parentXMLText.substr(0,originalNodePos);
00268     newXML += newNode.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00269     newXML += parentXMLText.substr(originalNodePos);
00270     var newDoc = new XMLDoc(newXML, this.errFn);
00271     return newDoc;
00272 
00273 } // end function _XMLDoc_insertNodeAfter

00277 function _XMLDoc_insertNodeInto (referenceNode, insertNode) {
00278     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00279     function:   _XMLDoc_insertNodeInto
00280 
00281     Author: mike@idle.org
00282 
00283     Description:
00284         inserts a new XML node into the reference node;
00285 
00286         for example, if we insert the node <tag2>hello</tag2>
00287         into tag1 in the xml <rootnode><tag1><tag3>foo</tag3></tag1></rootnode>
00288         we will end up with <rootnode><tag1><tag2>hello</tag2><tag3>foo</tag3></tag1></rootnode>
00289 
00290         NOTE: the return value of this function is a new XMLDoc object!!!!
00291     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00292 
00293     var parentXMLText = this.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00294     var selectedNodeXMLText = referenceNode.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00295     var endFirstTag = selectedNodeXMLText.indexOf(">") + 1;
00296     var originalNodePos = parentXMLText.indexOf(selectedNodeXMLText) + endFirstTag;
00297     var newXML = parentXMLText.substr(0,originalNodePos);
00298     newXML += insertNode.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00299     newXML += parentXMLText.substr(originalNodePos);
00300     var newDoc = new XMLDoc(newXML, this.errFn);
00301     return newDoc;
00302 
00303 
00304 } // end function _XMLDoc_insertNodeInto

00308     function:   _XMLDoc_insertNodeInto
00309 
00310     Author: xwisdom@yahoo.com
00311 
00312     Description:
00313         allows an already existing XMLDoc object to load XML
00314     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00315     this.topNode=null;
00316     this.hasErrors = false;
00317     this.source=source;
00318     // parse the document
00319     return this.parse();
00320 
00321 } // end function _XMLDoc_loadXML

00323 function _XMLDoc_parse() {
00324     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00325     function:   _XMLDoc_parse
00326 
00327     Author: mike@idle.org
00328 
00329     Description:
00330         scans through the source for opening and closing tags
00331         checks that the tags open and close in a sensible order
00332     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00333 
00334     var pos = 0;
00335 
00336     // set up the arrays used to store positions of < and > characters
00337 
00338     err = false;
00339 
00340     while(!err) {
00341         var closing_tag_prefix = '';
00342         var chpos = this.source.indexOf('<',pos);
00343         var open_length = 1;
00344 
00345         var open;
00346         var close;
00347 
00348         if (chpos ==-1) {
00349             break;
00350         }
00351 
00352         open = chpos;
00353 
00354         // create a text node
00355 
00356         var str = this.source.substring(pos, open);
00357 
00358         if (str.length!=0) {
00359             err = !this.handleNode(new XMLNode('TEXT',this, str));
00360         }
00361 
00362         // handle Programming Instructions - they can't reliably be handled as tags
00363 
00364         if (chpos == this.source.indexOf("<?",pos)) {
00365             pos = this.parsePI(this.source, pos + 2);
00366             if (pos==0) {
00367                 err=true;
00368             }
00369             continue;
00370         }
00371 
00372         // nobble the document type definition
00373 
00374         if (chpos == this.source.indexOf("<!DOCTYPE",pos)) {
00375             pos = this.parseDTD(this.source, chpos+ 9);
00376             if (pos==0) {
00377                 err=true;
00378             }
00379             continue;
00380         }
00381 
00382         // if we found an open comment, we need to ignore angle brackets
00383         // until we find a close comment
00384 
00385         if(chpos == this.source.indexOf('<!--',pos)) {
00386             open_length = 4;
00387             closing_tag_prefix = '--';
00388         }
00389 
00390         // similarly, if we find an open CDATA, we need to ignore all angle
00391         // brackets until a close CDATA sequence is found
00392 
00393         if (chpos == this.source.indexOf('<![CDATA[',pos)) {
00394             open_length = 9;
00395             closing_tag_prefix = ']]';
00396         }
00397 
00398         // look for the closing sequence
00399 
00400         chpos = this.source.indexOf(closing_tag_prefix + '>',chpos);
00401         if (chpos ==-1) {
00402             return this.error("expected closing tag sequence: " + closing_tag_prefix + '>');
00403         }
00404 
00405         close = chpos + closing_tag_prefix.length;
00406 
00407         // create a tag node
00408 
00409         str = this.source.substring(open+1, close);
00410 
00411         var n = this.parseTag(str);
00412         if (n) {
00413             err = !this.handleNode(n);
00414         }
00415 
00416         pos = close +1;
00417 
00418     // and loop
00419 
00420     }
00421     return !err;
00422 
00423 } // end function _XMLDoc_parse

00427 function _XMLDoc_parseAttribute(src,pos,node) {
00428     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00429     function:   _XMLDoc_parseAttribute
00430 
00431     Author: mike@idle.org
00432 
00433     Description:
00434         parse an attribute out of a tag string
00435 
00436     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00437 
00438     // chew up the whitespace, if any
00439 
00440     while ((pos<src.length) && (whitespace.indexOf(src.charAt(pos))!=-1)) {
00441         pos++;
00442     }
00443 
00444     // if there's nothing else, we have no (more) attributes - just break out
00445 
00446     if (pos >= src.length) {
00447         return pos;
00448     }
00449 
00450     var p1 = pos;
00451 
00452     while ((pos < src.length) && (src.charAt(pos)!='=')) {
00453         pos++;
00454     }
00455 
00456     var msg = "attributes must have values";
00457 
00458     // parameters without values aren't allowed.
00459 
00460     if(pos >= src.length) {
00461         return this.error(msg);
00462     }
00463 
00464     // extract the parameter name
00465 
00466     var paramname = trim(src.substring(p1,pos++),false,true);
00467 
00468     // chew up whitespace
00469 
00470     while ((pos < src.length) && (whitespace.indexOf(src.charAt(pos))!=-1)) {
00471         pos++;
00472     }
00473 
00474     // throw an error if we've run out of string
00475 
00476     if (pos >= src.length) {
00477         return this.error(msg);
00478     }
00479 
00480     msg = "attribute values must be in quotes";
00481 
00482     // check for a quote mark to identify the beginning of the attribute value
00483 
00484     var quote = src.charAt(pos++);
00485 
00486     // throw an error if we didn't find one
00487 
00488     if (quotes.indexOf(quote)==-1) {
00489         return this.error(msg);
00490     }
00491 
00492     p1 = pos;
00493 
00494     while ((pos < src.length) && (src.charAt(pos)!=quote)) {
00495         pos++;
00496     }
00497 
00498     // throw an error if we found no closing quote
00499 
00500     if (pos >= src.length) {
00501         return this.error(msg);
00502     }
00503 
00504     // store the parameter
00505 
00506     if (!node.addAttribute(paramname,trim(src.substring(p1,pos++),false,true))) {
00507         return 0;
00508     }
00509 
00510     return pos;
00511 
00512 }  //end function _XMLDoc_parseAttribute

00516 function _XMLDoc_parseDTD(str,pos) {
00517     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00518     function:   _XMLDoc_parseDTD
00519 
00520     Author: mike@idle.org
00521 
00522     Description:
00523         parse a document type declaration
00524 
00525         NOTE: we're just going to discard the DTD
00526 
00527     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00528     // we're just going to discard the DTD
00529 
00530     var firstClose = str.indexOf('>',pos);
00531 
00532     if (firstClose==-1) {
00533         return this.error("error in DTD: expected '>'");
00534     }
00535 
00536     var closing_tag_prefix = '';
00537 
00538     var firstOpenSquare = str.indexOf('[',pos);
00539 
00540     if ((firstOpenSquare!=-1) && (firstOpenSquare < firstClose)) {
00541         closing_tag_prefix = ']';
00542     }
00543 
00544     while(true) {
00545         var closepos = str.indexOf(closing_tag_prefix + '>',pos);
00546 
00547         if (closepos ==-1) {
00548             return this.error("expected closing tag sequence: " + closing_tag_prefix + '>');
00549         }
00550 
00551         pos = closepos + closing_tag_prefix.length +1;
00552 
00553         if (str.substring(closepos-1,closepos+2) != ']]>') {
00554             break;
00555         }
00556     }
00557     return pos;
00558 
00559 } // end function _XMLDoc_ParseDTD

00562 function _XMLDoc_parsePI(str,pos) {
00563     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00564     function:   _XMLDoc_parsePI
00565 
00566     Author: mike@idle.org
00567 
00568     Description:
00569         parse a processing instruction
00570 
00571         NOTE: we just swallow them up at the moment
00572 
00573     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00574     // we just swallow them up
00575 
00576     var closepos = str.indexOf('?>',pos);
00577     return closepos + 2;
00578 
00579 } // end function _XMLDoc_parsePI

00583 function _XMLDoc_parseTag(src) {
00584     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00585     function:   _XMLDoc_parseTag
00586 
00587     Author: mike@idle.org
00588 
00589     Description:
00590         parse out a non-text element (incl. CDATA, comments)
00591         handles the parsing of attributes
00592     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00593 
00594     // if it's a comment, strip off the packaging, mark it a comment node
00595     // and return it
00596 
00597     if (src.indexOf('!--')==0) {
00598         return new XMLNode('COMMENT', this, src.substring(3,src.length-2));
00599     }
00600 
00601     // if it's CDATA, do similar
00602 
00603     if (src.indexOf('![CDATA[')==0) {
00604         return new XMLNode('CDATA', this, src.substring(8,src.length-2));
00605     }
00606 
00607     var n = new XMLNode();
00608     n.doc = this;
00609 
00610 
00611     if (src.charAt(0)=='/') {
00612         n.nodeType = 'CLOSE';
00613         src = src.substring(1);
00614     }
00615     else {
00616         // otherwise it's an open tag (possibly an empty element)
00617         n.nodeType = 'OPEN';
00618     }
00619 
00620     // if the last character is a /, check it's not a CLOSE tag
00621 
00622     if (src.charAt(src.length-1)=='/') {
00623         if (n.nodeType=='CLOSE') {
00624             return this.error("singleton close tag");
00625         }
00626         else {
00627             n.nodeType = 'SINGLE';
00628         }
00629 
00630         // strip off the last character
00631 
00632         src = src.substring(0,src.length-1);
00633     }
00634 
00635     // set up the properties as appropriate
00636 
00637     if (n.nodeType!='CLOSE') {
00638         n.attributes = new Array();
00639     }
00640 
00641     if (n.nodeType=='OPEN') {
00642         n.children = new Array();
00643     }
00644 
00645     // trim the whitespace off the remaining content
00646 
00647     src = trim(src,true,true);
00648 
00649     // chuck out an error if there's nothing left
00650 
00651     if (src.length==0) {
00652         return this.error("empty tag");
00653     }
00654 
00655     // scan forward until a space...
00656 
00657     var endOfName = firstWhiteChar(src,0);
00658 
00659     // if there is no space, this is just a name (e.g. (<tag>, <tag/> or </tag>
00660 
00661     if (endOfName==-1) {
00662         n.tagName = src;
00663         return n;
00664     }
00665 
00666     // otherwise, we should expect attributes - but store the tag name first
00667 
00668     n.tagName = src.substring(0,endOfName);
00669 
00670     // start from after the tag name
00671 
00672     var pos = endOfName;
00673 
00674     // now we loop:
00675 
00676     while(pos< src.length) {
00677         pos = this.parseAttribute(src, pos, n);
00678         if (this.pos==0) {
00679             return null;
00680         }
00681 
00682         // and loop
00683 
00684     }
00685     return n;
00686 
00687 } // end function _XMLDoc_parseTag

00691 function _XMLDoc_removeNodeFromTree(node) {
00692     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00693     function:   _XMLDoc_removeNodeFromTree
00694 
00695     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
00696 
00697     Description:
00698         removes the specified node from the tree
00699 
00700         NOTE: the return value of this function is a new XMLDoc object
00701 
00702     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00703 
00704     var parentXMLText = this.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00705     var selectedNodeXMLText = node.getUnderlyingXMLText();
00706     var originalNodePos = parentXMLText.indexOf(selectedNodeXMLText);
00707     var newXML = parentXMLText.substr(0,originalNodePos);
00708     newXML += parentXMLText.substr(originalNodePos + selectedNodeXMLText.length);
00709     var newDoc = new XMLDoc(newXML, this.errFn);
00710     return newDoc;
00711 } // end function _XMLDoc_removeNodeFromTree

00715 function _XMLDoc_replaceNodeContents(referenceNode, newContents) {
00716     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00717     function:   _XMLDoc_replaceNodeContents
00718 
00719     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
00720 
00721     Description:
00722 
00723         make a node object out of the newContents text
00724         coming in ----
00725 
00726         The "X" node will be thrown away and only the children
00727         used to replace the contents of the reference node
00728 
00729         NOTE: the return value of this function is a new XMLDoc object
00730 
00731     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00732 
00733     var newNode = this.createXMLNode("<X>" + newContents + "</X>");
00734     referenceNode.children = newNode.children;
00735     return this;
00736 } // end function _XMLDoc_replaceNodeContents

00739 function _XMLDoc_selectNode(tagpath){
00740     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00741     function:   _XMLDoc_selectNode
00742 
00743     Author:     xwisdom@yahoo.com
00744 
00745     Description:
00746         selects a single node using the nodes tag path.
00747         examples: /node1/node2  or  /taga/tag1[0]/tag2
00748     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00749 
00750     tagpath = trim(tagpath, true, true);
00751 
00752     var srcnode,node,tag,params,elm,rg;
00753     var tags,attrName,attrValue,ok;
00754     srcnode=node=((this.source)?this.docNode:this);
00755     if (!tagpath) return node;
00756     if(tagpath.indexOf('/')==0)tagpath=tagpath.substr(1);
00757     tagpath=tagpath.replace(tag,'');
00758     tags=tagpath.split('/');
00759     tag=tags[0];
00760     if(tag){
00761         if(tagpath.indexOf('/')==0)tagpath=tagpath.substr(1);
00762         tagpath=tagpath.replace(tag,'');
00763         params=_XMLDoc_getTagNameParams(tag,this);
00764         tag=params[0];elm=params[1];
00765         attrName=params[2];attrValue=params[3];
00766         node=(tag=='*')? node.getElements():node.getElements(tag);
00767         if (node.length) {
00768             if(elm<0){
00769                 srcnode=node;var i=0;
00770                 while(i<srcnode.length){
00771                     if(attrName){
00772                         if (srcnode[i].getAttribute(attrName)!=attrValue) ok=false;
00773                         else ok=true;
00774                     }else ok=true;
00775                     if(ok){
00776                         node=srcnode[i].selectNode(tagpath);
00777                         if(node) return node;
00778                     }
00779                     i++;
00780                 }
00781             }else if (elm<node.length){
00782                 node=node[elm].selectNode(tagpath);
00783                 if(node) return node;
00784             }
00785         }
00786     }
00787 } // end function _XMLDoc_selectNode
00788 
00789 function _XMLDoc_selectNodeText(tagpath){
00790     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00791     function:   _XMLDoc_selectNodeText
00792 
00793     Author:     xwisdom@yahoo.com
00794 
00795     Description:
00796         selects a single node using the nodes tag path and then returns the node text.
00797     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00798 
00799     var node=this.selectNode(tagpath);
00800     if (node != null) {
00801         return node.getText();
00802     }
00803     else {
00804         return null;
00805     }
00806 } // end function _XMLDoc_selectNodeText
00807

00823 
00824 function XMLNode(nodeType,doc, str) {
00825     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00826     function: xmlNode
00827 
00828     Author: mike@idle.org
00829 
00830     Description:
00831 
00832         XMLNode() is a constructor for a node of XML (text, comment, cdata, tag, etc)
00833 
00834         nodeType = indicates the node type of the node
00835         doc == contains a reference to the XMLDoc object describing the document
00836         str == contains the text for the tag or text entity
00837 
00838     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00839 
00840 
00841     // the content of text (also CDATA and COMMENT) nodes
00842     if (nodeType=='TEXT' || nodeType=='CDATA' || nodeType=='COMMENT' ) {
00843         this.content = str;
00844     }
00845     else {
00846         this.content = null;
00847     }
00848 
00849     this.attributes = null; // an array of attributes (used as a hash table)
00850     this.children = null;   // an array (list) of the children of this node
00851     this.doc = doc;         // a reference to the document
00852     this.nodeType = nodeType;          // the type of the node
00853     this.parent = "";
00854     this.tagName = "";           // the name of the tag (if a tag node)
00855 
00856     // configure the methods
00857     this.addAttribute = _XMLNode_addAttribute;
00858     this.addElement = _XMLNode_addElement;
00859     this.getAttribute = _XMLNode_getAttribute;
00860     this.getAttributeNames = _XMLNode_getAttributeNames;
00861     this.getElementById = _XMLNode_getElementById;
00862     this.getElements = _XMLNode_getElements;
00863     this.getText = _XMLNode_getText;
00864     this.getParent = _XMLNode_getParent;
00865     this.getUnderlyingXMLText = _XMLNode_getUnderlyingXMLText;
00866     this.removeAttribute = _XMLNode_removeAttribute;
00867     this.selectNode = _XMLDoc_selectNode;
00868     this.selectNodeText = _XMLDoc_selectNodeText;
00869     this.toString = _XMLNode_toString;
00870 
00871 }  // end function XMLNode
00872 
00873 
00874 function _XMLNode_addAttribute(attributeName,attributeValue) {
00875     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00876     function: _XMLNode_addAttribute
00877 
00878     Author: mike@idle.org
00879 
00880     Description:
00881         add an attribute to a node
00882     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00883 
00884     //if the name is found, the old value is overwritten by the new value
00885     this.attributes['_' + attributeName] = attributeValue;
00886     return true;
00887 
00888 } // end function _XMLNode_addAttribute
00889 
00890 
00891 
00892 function _XMLNode_addElement(node) {
00893     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00894     function: _XMLNode_addElement
00895 
00896     Author: mike@idle.org
00897 
00898     Description:
00899         add an element child to a node
00900     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00901     node.parent = this;
00902     this.children[this.children.length] = node;
00903     return true;
00904 
00905 } // end function _XMLNode_addElement
00906 
00907 
00908 function _XMLNode_getAttribute(name) {
00909     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00910     function: _XMLNode_getAttribute
00911 
00912     Author: mike@idle.org
00913 
00914     Description:
00915         get the value of a named attribute from an element node
00916 
00917         NOTE: we prefix with "_" because of the weird 'length' meta-property
00918 
00919     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00920     if (this.attributes == null) {
00921         return null;
00922     }
00923     return this.attributes['_' + name];
00924 } // end function _XMLNode_getAttribute
00925 
00926 
00927 
00928 function _XMLNode_getAttributeNames() {
00929     /*******************************************************************************************************************
00930     function: _XMLNode_getAttributeNames
00931 
00932     Author: mike@idle.org
00933 
00934     Description:
00935         get a list of attribute names for the node
00936 
00937         NOTE: we prefix with "_" because of the weird 'length' meta-property
00938 
00939         NOTE: Version 1.0 of getAttributeNames breaks backwards compatibility. Previous to 1.0
00940         getAttributeNames would return null if there were no attributes. 1.0 now returns an
00941         array of length 0.
00942 
00943 
00944     *********************************************************************************************************************/
00945     if (this.attributes == null) {
00946         var ret = new Array();
00947         return ret;
00948     }
00949 
00950     var attlist = new Array();
00951 
00952     for (var a in this.attributes) {
00953         attlist[attlist.length] = a.substring(1);
00954     }
00955     return attlist;
00956 } // end function _XMLNode_getAttributeNames
00957 
00958 function _XMLNode_getElementById(id) {
00959 
00960     /***********************************************************************************
00961     Function: getElementById
00962 
00963     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
00964 
00965     Description:
00966         Brute force searches through the XML DOM tree
00967         to find the node with the unique ID passed in
00968 
00969     ************************************************************************************/
00970     var node = this;
00971     var ret;
00972 
00973     //alert("tag name=" + node.tagName);
00974     //alert("id=" + node.getAttribute("id"));
00975     if (node.getAttribute("id") == id) {
00976         return node;
00977     }
00978     else{
00979         var elements = node.getElements();
00980         //alert("length=" + rugrats.length);
00981         var intLoop = 0;
00982         //do NOT use a for loop here. For some reason
00983         //it kills some browsers!!!
00984         while (intLoop < elements.length) {
00985             //alert("intLoop=" + intLoop);
00986             var element = elements[intLoop];
00987             //alert("recursion");
00988             ret = element.getElementById(id);
00989             if (ret != null) {
00990                 //alert("breaking");
00991                 break;
00992             }
00993             intLoop++;
00994         }
00995     }
00996     return ret;
00997 } // end function _XMLNode_getElementById
00998 
00999 
01000 function _XMLNode_getElements(byName) {
01001     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01002     function:   _XMLNode_getElements
01003 
01004     Author: mike@idle.org
01005 
01006     Description:
01007         get an array of element children of a node
01008         with an optional filter by name
01009 
01010         NOTE: Version 1.0 of getElements breaks backwards compatibility. Previous to 1.0
01011         getElements would return null if there were no attributes. 1.0 now returns an
01012         array of length 0.
01013 
01014 
01015     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01016     if (this.children==null) {
01017         var ret = new Array();
01018         return ret;
01019     }
01020 
01021     var elements = new Array();
01022     for (var i=0; i<this.children.length; i++) {
01023         if ((this.children[i].nodeType=='ELEMENT') && ((byName==null) || (this.children[i].tagName == byName))) {
01024             elements[elements.length] = this.children[i];
01025         }
01026     }
01027     return elements;
01028 } // end function _XMLNode_getElements
01029 
01030 
01031 
01032 function _XMLNode_getText() {
01033     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01034     function:       _XMLNode_getText
01035 
01036     Author: mike@idle.org
01037 
01038     Description:
01039         a method to get the text of a given node (recursively, if it's an element)
01040     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01041 
01042     if (this.nodeType=='ELEMENT') {
01043         if (this.children==null) {
01044             return null;
01045         }
01046         var str = "";
01047         for (var i=0; i < this.children.length; i++) {
01048             var t = this.children[i].getText();
01049             str +=  (t == null ? "" : t);
01050         }
01051         return str;
01052     }
01053     else if (this.nodeType=='TEXT') {
01054         return convertEscapes(this.content);
01055     }
01056     else {
01057         return this.content;
01058     }
01059 } // end function _XMLNode_getText
01060 
01061 
01062 
01063 function _XMLNode_getParent() {
01064     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01065     function:       _XMLNode_getParent
01066 
01067     Author: mike@idle.org
01068 
01069     Description:
01070         get the parent of this node
01071     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01072     return this.parent;
01073 
01074 } // end function _XMLNode_getParent
01075 
01076 
01077 function _XMLNode_getUnderlyingXMLText() {
01078     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01079     function:       David Joham
01080 
01081     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
01082 
01083     Description:
01084         returns the underlying XML text for the node
01085         by calling the _displayElement function
01086     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01087 
01088     var strRet = "";
01089     strRet = _displayElement(this, strRet);
01090     return strRet;
01091 
01092 } // end function _XMLNode_getUnderlyingXMLText
01093 
01094 
01095 
01096 function _XMLNode_removeAttribute(attributeName) {
01097     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01098     function:       _XMLNode_removeAttribute
01099 
01100     Author: djoham@yahoo.com
01101 
01102     Description:
01103         remove an attribute from a node
01104     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01105     if(attributeName == null) {
01106         return this.doc.error("You must pass an attribute name into the removeAttribute function");
01107     }
01108 
01109     //now remove the attribute from the list.
01110     // I want to keep the logic for adding attribtues in one place. I'm
01111     // going to get a temp array of attributes and values here and then
01112     // use the addAttribute function to re-add the attributes
01113     var attributes = this.getAttributeNames();
01114     var intCount = attributes.length;
01115     var tmpAttributeValues = new Array();
01116     for ( intLoop = 0; intLoop < intCount; intLoop++) {
01117         tmpAttributeValues[intLoop] = this.getAttribute(attributes[intLoop]);
01118     }
01119 
01120     // now blow away the old attribute list
01121     this.attributes = new Array();
01122 
01123     //now add the attributes back to the array - leaving out the one we're removing
01124     for (intLoop = 0; intLoop < intCount; intLoop++) {
01125         if ( attributes[intLoop] != attributeName) {
01126             this.addAttribute(attributes[intLoop], tmpAttributeValues[intLoop]);
01127         }
01128     }
01129 
01130 return true;
01131 
01132 } // end function _XMLNode_removeAttribute
01133 
01134 
01135 
01136 function _XMLNode_toString() {
01137     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01138     function:       _XMLNode_toString
01139 
01140     Author: mike@idle.org
01141 
01142     Description:
01143         produces a diagnostic string description of a node
01144     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01145     return "" + this.nodeType + ":" + (this.nodeType=='TEXT' || this.nodeType=='CDATA' || this.nodeType=='COMMENT' ? this.content : this.tagName);
01146 
01147 } // end function _XMLNode_toString
01148 
01149 function trim(trimString, leftTrim, rightTrim) {
01150     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01151     function: trim
01152 
01153     Author: may106@psu.edu
01154 
01155     Description:
01156         helper function to trip a string (trimString) of leading (leftTrim)
01157         and trailing (rightTrim) whitespace
01158 
01159     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01160     if (isEmpty(trimString)) {
01161         return "";
01162     }
01163 
01164     // the general focus here is on minimal method calls - hence only one
01165     // substring is done to complete the trim.
01166 
01167     if (leftTrim == null) {
01168         leftTrim = true;
01169     }
01170 
01171     if (rightTrim == null) {
01172         rightTrim = true;
01173     }
01174 
01175     var left=0;
01176     var right=0;
01177     var i=0;
01178     var k=0;
01179 
01180     // modified to properly handle strings that are all whitespace
01181     if (leftTrim == true) {
01182         while ((i<trimString.length) && (whitespace.indexOf(trimString.charAt(i++))!=-1)) {
01183             left++;
01184         }
01185     }
01186     if (rightTrim == true) {
01187         k=trimString.length-1;
01188         while((k>=left) && (whitespace.indexOf(trimString.charAt(k--))!=-1)) {
01189             right++;
01190         }
01191     }
01192     return trimString.substring(left, trimString.length - right);
01193 } // end function trim
01194 
01195 function isEmpty(str) {
01196     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01197     function: isEmpty
01198 
01199     Author: mike@idle.org
01200 
01201     Description:
01202         convenience function to identify an empty string
01203 
01204     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01205     return (str==null) || (str.length==0);
01206 
01207 } // end function isEmpty
01208 
01209 function firstWhiteChar(str,pos) {
01210     /*******************************************************************************************************************
01211     function: firstWhiteChar
01212 
01213     Author: may106@psu.edu ?
01214 
01215     Description:
01216         return the position of the first whitespace character in str after position pos
01217 
01218     *********************************************************************************************************************/
01219     if (isEmpty(str)) {
01220         return -1;
01221     }
01222 
01223     while(pos < str.length) {
01224         if (whitespace.indexOf(str.charAt(pos))!=-1) {
01225             return pos;
01226         }
01227         else {
01228             pos++;
01229         }
01230     }
01231     return str.length;
01232 } // end function firstWhiteChar
01233 
01234 var whitespace = "\n\r\t ";
01235 var quotes = "\"'";
